reviews.review_text: I've been playing this game since beta when this game was under Nexon. I'm writing this review because the other reviews were upsetting. Many of the other reviewers only did it to get $40, which was what Redbana was offering to those who left good reviews. That is why many of the reviewers left their IGNs in their review, which is not usually seen in a Steam review. You'll also notice that many of these reviewers don't have any other games and/or have only reviewed one game (this game). So the reviews are very biased. It is very disappointing to see this kind of abuse.  TL;DR This game is fun, but most of the people that play are terrible. If you plan on playing this game, be prepared for a lot of drama.

I've been playing this game for 600+ hours. I know it's not much but i still have something to say. To be honest, i found out about the bribed reviews like last week i think. I'm very dissapointed. The people who wrote positive reviews for in-game currency basically lied to everyone about how 'great' this game is. I won't lie, i got sucked into the game right after i saw the video of it on Steam. I thought it would be fun. Well the first 2 weeks were awesome to be honest. I loved the game very much, but then it changed. As i've noticed, in some of the reviews, people are saying that the graphics are horrible, no settings, etc. Sure, the graphics aren't that great and a game having no settings is just ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, but i don't look at the graphics and all that, i just look at the whole gameplay. Yet i am unsatisfied with some things in this game, so i'm going to write some of my Pros and Cons.  Pros and Cons in my opinion:  Pros:  +The songs might be old, but i still love them and i wouldn't change them. I would just add some new ones. +There are a lot of modes to play, so you won't get bored so easily. (My fav is actually Guitar and Choreo 4 keys CC4) +There are a lot of friendly people in this game and you can talk to them. (Like i said, everything is my opinion) +You don't have to pay2win, which i find very annoying in any kind of games. +It's sort of an 'online dating site' i guess, from my experience some people actually have long lasting online relationships. (I'm also in a online relationship atm, but that's not important)  So i guess these are all the Pros i can think of in my opinion. Now for the Cons and oh boy, i have a lot of them in mind.  Cons:  -Bugs in this game are pretty terrible, especially in Club Dance and Beat Rush. -Crashes. I'm not saying they happen often, but it would be still nice to fix that problem. -The updates are ♥♥♥♥♥♥, since after each update, i've noticed that they don't do anything about the bugs in this game. -As far as i know, the GM's have IQ's of snails, since they banned my FAM for 'hacking' because some guy reported it without any evidence of that crime at all. -A lot of drama. -Most of the stuff in this game costs real money, so if you want to look 'pretty' and you want to stay that way, you have to pay up. -There are also ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ people. -The Events always require for you to pay for something, so ♥♥♥♥ that. -The Tournaments are dead, but they start at a very different time, so i can't really attend them.  So yeah, like i said, these Pros and Cons are basically my thoughts about the game. True, i would be dissapointed if the game was shut down. And i have quite the history with this game. But if it does shut down, i'll just move on. Though i really want to say 1 thing to GM's of this game: Fix the ♥♥♥♥ing bugs will ya? And try turning on your brains, since, as you can see, you're losing people and getting bad reviews. And bribing other players? That's just pathetic. ♥♥♥♥ing pull yourself together.

Audition has come a long way and it has changed a lot over time. There are several modes, different maps, new outfits, a new marriage system, etc. However, since changing from Nexon to RedBana, the community has become pretty dead. Most of the time, game rooms are locked because of people playing with others that they personally know or are close to in game. There are barely any males, making the marriage system difficult, as well as ballroom dance and couple dance modes a challenge to even start. High levels tend to dominate over this game leaving new comers feeling at a huge disadvantage. (It's not fun when you continue to keep losing right?). The songs don't update often so you're stuck with having to pick from the same song list. It would be nice to have more up to date, popular songs. Despite all this, I find that I like to play Audition when I'm extremely bored because there is still pleasure in being able to punch in all the arrow keys before your time limit. Audition seems more fun when you're married because you can spend your time trying to upgrade your ring and work on your garden. Otherwise, the game itself and community has a lot of work that needs to be done.
This game won't run for me but download if you like things similar to this game. (This game is not comparable to osu! just saying.)

Um... well the gameplay is alright, however the game expects you to press over 10 keys in half a second; I mean what? When I played this game, the community was friendly however sometimes you would cross over some harmless discrimination. Moreover, whilst your trying to find a 'decent' lobby, ('decent' meaning a beginner newbie like me who doesnt have sonic fingers), its extremely hard to come across one, and you'll end up creating a room yourself, waiting like 15 mins to find an afk player chilling in your lobby, and then you'll be playing in your own game ALONE for like the rest of your day.   Okay. So clothing options. I remember these quite briefly, however they were quite interesting. In game, the currency which enabled to buy clothes are BEATS/DEN, and Cash. Beats/DEN are in game currency which you get through levelling up, opening gift boxes, and other general stuff with gameplay. I dont realaly remember the DEN currency, however it was quite tight on how most of the clothes in the store required cash, which you could only acquire with real money. These clothes were legitimate, whereas the in game currency ones were quite run down and basic.   I recommend this to people who really can master the keyboard keys - be a pro at this game and you'll get many fans. If you can't play, you'll find this gaming experience very boring.

First, let me just say that I love this game so much. I've been playing audition since back in 2010. Its a game that allows you to interact with other people from all over the world. The music is amazing and yes, it will be kind of hard at first to get used to the arrows and the speed , but it is definitely worth it. You can just lock yourself in one of the rooms and practice, it gets easier like everything in life. This game is like my second life and I love meeting awesome new people everyday. This is indeed a very old game, but the fact that it still remains perhaps 'alive', says it all. People who stopped playing before, always end up coming back to audition xD However, one of the cons of this game is that the shop is a little bit expensive, but you can still buy your clothing with 'beats' , its just not going to be as cute as buying cash clothes. Overall, I highly recommend this game <3

A different take on the traditional rhythm game genre, with having you have to input combinations of directions to the beat as opposed to single key strokes. I played this a lot back when nexon owned it, and haven't found another game that has quite the same type of mechanics. Definitely worth a shot if you enjoy rhythm games. It's free, after all.

How the titan has fallen. Level 45 veteran here. This game was gold at the start with Nexon. Once it switched to RedBana it became a cult. There was a lacking newer population joining the game and the existing one went to college, new games, better games, etc. I haven't even touched this or remembered it exists for a long time until I hear a song I use to play. It's honestly just a dying game since the new management isn't trying to revive the game. It offers a lot and still really fun if you like a challenge. Problem is you won't level up since it's hard to find people to play with now. Try it out, soon as anything annoys you(except the difficulty, that would mean you're a scrub) get out. It's not worth investing time on anymore.

Alright, time for an actual review of this game as of 2015.  This game is pretty fun, once you get the hang of it. It has one of the sharpest learning curves that I've come across, and easily the most difficult multiplayer rhythm game out there to pick up and play.  The community is pretty small, and overall pretty nice.   As of now, songs are plentiful, but they're mostly underground/mainstream EDM and Korean music.  There is only one p2w aspect to the game and even then nobody uses it because it helps very little. It's also disabled in any competitive modes, which is great.   This game as one fatal flaw - it's a game from 2006 that hasn't aged well at all. No graphics options in-game (uses all settings from your drivers, and even then it only picks up drivers from nvidia cards because this game uses OpenGL). 1024x768 locked resolution. Windows 8.1 compatibility issues out of the box (issue with a certain KB update). Anti-cheat issues with certain programs. The list goes on and on. I can't see a typical new user with no experience with these types of games genuinely enjoying Audition when theres a lot of options that PC gamers expect to see with any game blatantly missing.  If you can deal with those flaws, give Audition a try. Otherwise, Audition's sequel should be coming over to the West in a year or so (World In Audition). It is a MUCH better game, albeit having some minor differences that regular Audition players come to expect. If World In Audition came to Steam, I would wholeheartedly recommend it.  IGN - Voltex
